CliGitMv

public CliGitMv()
Method Detail

mv

public GitMvResponseImpl mv(java.io.File repoPath,
                            java.io.File source,
                            java.io.File destination)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitMv
Moves the specified source file/symlink/directory to the destination file/symlink/directory. If destination is non-existant then same as rename.

Specified by:
mv in interface IGitMv
Parameters:
repoPath - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to move/rename against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
source - The source file/folder/symlink which is to be renamed or moved to a different location. It should be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
destination - The destination file/folder/symlink which the source is renamed or moved to. It should be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
Returns:
The results from the git-mv. It is expected that GitMv does not notify when a move was successful. This follows the response that git-mv itself gives. If the move/rename fails for any reason, proper exception messages are generated and thrown.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error excecuting git-mv.

mv

public GitMvResponseImpl mv(java.io.File repoPath,
                            java.util.List<java.io.File> sources,
                            java.io.File destination)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitMv
Moves the specified source files/symlinks/directories to the destination directory.

Specified by:
mv in interface IGitMv
Parameters:
repoPath - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to move/rename against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
sources - The List of source file/folder/symlink which are to be moved to a different location. The paths specified in this list must all be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
destination - The destination file/folder/symlink which the source is renamed or moved to. It should be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
Returns:
The results from the git-mv. It is expected that GitMv does not notify when a move was successful. This follows the response that git-mv itself gives. If the move/rename fails for any reason, proper exception messages are generated and thrown.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-mv.

options - The options to git-mv command.
sources - The List of source file/folder/symlink which are to be moved to a different location. The paths specified in this list must all be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). destination - The destination file/folder/symlink which the source is renamed or moved to. It should be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

buildCommand

protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildCommand(GitMvOptions options,
                                                        java.util.List<java.io.File> source,
                                                        java.io.File destination)
Builds a list of command arguments to pass to ProcessBuilder.

Parameters:
options - The options to include on the command line.
source - The source file/directory/symlink to rename/move.
destination - The destination file/directory/symlink to rename/move to.
Returns:
A list of the individual arguments to pass to ProcessBuilder.
